 The "gun show loophole" is nothing more than a misnomer created by the anti-gunners to scare the sheeple into thinking that there's a serious problem. They say that unlicensed dealers can sell firearms at gun shows. The unlicensed dealers are the ones who sell clothing, videos and other such, and a few of them are private collectors who might sell off a half dozen old guns from their own collection; the type that criminals have no interest in getting since they don't hold enough ammo or aren't made of polymers.
 
 Unlike most people I've actually been to gun shows, I know how they're run and I can tell you that there ARE fully licensed dealers at these events, and there ARE police there too.
 
 The so called "gun show loophole" is the fact that there's never been any federal law that keeps private citizens from selling between themselves without involving an FFL dealer or any tracking paperwork. They don't like this because it makes guns impossible to trace between private sales. They want it ended so all guns have to be registered somewhere with someone or another.
